boat.full_description: The 11 foot long Scow originated in the 1920s as a sailing tender for larger cruising yachts, but over the years, has become popular as a single-handed sheltered water racing dinghy. The rig is a single balanced lug, with the mast and spars designed to fit within the length of the boat. There are many slight variations of the basic design in the Solent area and beyond, with the Avon Scow being the standard Scow dinghy in use at the Christchurch Sailing Club.
boat.name: Mucky Duck
boat.short_description: A popular single-handed sheltered water racing dinghy
